questions.question: An ION is
options: A substance that disassociates into ions when in water thereby giving a solution that is capable of conducting electricity.

questions.question: Osmotic pressure is
options: The pressure required to prevent osmosis from occurring

questions.question: Intracellur fluid makes up how much of an animals bodyweight?
The main ANION in interstitial fluid is
What triggers the production of ADH?
What stimulates the release of aldosternoe
A sudden redness of the skin is known as:
The term gavage indicates:
options: Administration of a liquid feeding into the stomach
Irrigation of the stomach with a solution
A surgical opening through the abdomen to the stomach

questions.question: A patient states that he has difficulty sleeping in the hospital because of noise. Which of the following would be an appropriate nursing action?
options: Administer a sedative at bedtime, as ordered by the physician
Ambulate the patient for 5 minutes before he retires
Give the patient a glass of warm milk before bedtime
Close the patient's door from 9pm to 7am

questions.question: Which of the following nursing theorists is credited with developing a conceptual model specific to nursing, with man as the central focus?
If a patient is injured because a nurse acted in a wrongful manner, which party could be held liable along with the nurse?
Which of the following nursing theorists developed a conceptual model based on the belief that all persons strive to achieve self-care?
Jake is complaining of shortness of breath. The nurse assesses his respiratory rate to be 30 breaths per minute and documents that Jake is tachypneic. The nurse understands that tachypnea means:
options: Pulse rate greater than 100 beats per minute
Respiratory rate greater than 20 breaths per minute

questions.question: The nurse listens to Mrs. Sullen’s lungs and notes a hissing sound or musical sound. The nurse documents this as:
The nurse in charge measures a patient’s temperature at 101 degrees F. What is the equivalent centigrade temperature?
Which approach to problem-solving tests any number of solutions until one is found that works for that particular problem?
What is the order of the nursing process?
options: Assessing, diagnosing, implementing, evaluating, and planning
Diagnosing, assessing, planning, implementing, and evaluating
Assessing, diagnosing, planning, implementing, and evaluating
Planning, evaluating, diagnosing, assessing, and implementing

questions.question: During the planning phase of the nursing process, which of the following is the outcome?
What is an example of a subjective data?
options: Heart rate of 68 beats per minute
Client verbalized, “I feel pain when urinating.”

questions.question: Which expected outcome is correctly written?
options: “The patient will feel less nauseated in 24 hours.”
“The patient will eat the right amount of food daily.”
“The patient will identify all the high-salt food from a prepared list by discharge.”
